creditline: Gift of Sue Y.S. Kimm and Seymour Grufferman
description: blocky black and white image divided in sections; block of text at C shaped like a cauldron with line drawings of buildings in background; at top, a figure is bent over an object with silhouetted figure in doorway at R; three scenes at bottom: people working in front of a kiln, carving a mold, and hammering a vessel
inscription:
at top, from right: 大黒柱　板窓
in center: 慶長の昔前田家が高岡に築に当り　意を産業に用い　河内の国丹南より鋳物師を招き　今の金屋町を卸印地として移住させた。此の子孫が今日に及び　今尚　高岡は鋳物どころとして聞えが高い。
やがえ節は高岡の鋳物師が鋳物を熔かすに夕方より翌日に及ぶ長い時間をたたらを踏んで炉に風を送るその折り折り息杖を以って拍子をとる作業より自然に音頭として生れた本当の仕事の歌として生れた。
at bottom, from right: 火鉢造り　型挽　型焼き
portfolio: From Ironmonger's Marching Song (Yagaefu やがえ節)
text: Amano’s images depict the ironmongers in traditional clothes and are filled with elements related to the hard labor of working with metal.
title: Description (part 2)
